abstract: Number of extremely affluent defendants, including gold trader Reza Zarrab, billionaire Ng Lap Seng and lawyer Marc S Dreier, are testing whether courts will allow them to avoid prison while they await trial by proposing elaborate bail conditions that include creating deluxe personal jails for themselves; critics have said idea that wealthy can avoid spending time in jail is patently unfair, given that many poor people cannot do same.

headline.print_headline: Awaiting Trial, Willing to Pay for a Gilded Cage
headline.main: Rich Defendants’ Request to Judges: Lock Me Up in a Gilded Cage

snippet: Reza Zarrab, a Turkish gold trader facing trial in New York, is asking the courts to let him avoid pretrial detention by posting a $50 million bond and financing his own armed guards.
